1.text: And concerning spiritual things, brethren, I wish you not to be ignorant.

2.text: Ye know that ye were the nations, to dumb idols, as ye were led, being carried away.

3.text: Wherefore I make known to you, that none speaking in the Spirit of God calls Jesus anathema: and none can say Lord Jesus, but in the Holy Spirit.

4.text: And there are distinctions of favors, and the same Spirit.

5.text: And there are distinctions of services, and the same Lord.

6.text: And there are distinctions of performances, and it is the same God performing all things in all.

7.text: And to each is given the manifestation of the Spirit for profit.

8.text: For truly to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; and to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

9.text: And to another faith in the same Spirit; and to another graces of healings in the same Spirit;

10.text: And to another performances of powers; and to another discriminations of spirits; and to another kinds of tongues; and to another interpretation of tongues:

11.text: And all these works one and the same Spirit, dividing to each his own things as be will.

12.text: For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of the one body, being many, is one body: so also is Christ.

13.text: For also in one Spirit were we all immersed into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether servants or free; and we have all been given to drink into one Spirit.

14.text: For also the body is not one member, but many.

15.text: If the foot say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; by this is it not of the body.

16.text: And if the ear say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; by this is it not of the body.

17.text: If the whole body an eye, where the hearing If the whole hearing, where the smelling?

18.text: And now has God set the members each one of them in the body, as he would.

19.text: And if all were one member, where the body.

20.text: And now truly many members, and one body.

21.text: The eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee: or again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

22.text: But much rather the members of the body, seeming to be weak, are necessary:

23.text: And what we think to be less honourable of the body, upon these we put more abundant honour; and our unseemly parts have more abundant decorum.

24.text: And our becoming parts have no need: but God blended the body together, to the wanting having given more abundant honour:

25.text: That no division be in the body; but the members should care the same for one another.

26.text: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer together; or one member is honoured, all the members rejoice together.

27.text: And ye are the body of Christ, and members by parts.

28.text: And whom truly God set in the church, first the sent, second the prophets, third teachers, then powers, then graces of healings, helps, directions, kinds of tongues.

29.text: Not all sent: not all prophets: not all teachers: not all powers:

30.text: All have not the favors of healing: not all speaking with tongues: not all interpret accurately.

31.text: And be emulous of the better favors: and yet I shew you a way according to eminence.
